guidelines.title: Code of Conduct
guidelines.description: Contributors are expected to adhere to the repository's Code of Conduct. This includes respectful communication, collaboration, and creating a welcoming environment for all users and contributors.

guidelines.title: New Issues
guidelines.description: Before opening a new issue, search the existing issues to avoid duplicates. When creating an issue, provide a clear and concise description, steps to reproduce the issue, and the expected behavior.

guidelines.title: Pull Requests
guidelines.description: Provide a clear description of the changes made in the pull request. Ensure that the pull request is focused on a single issue or feature to make it easier to review.

guidelines.title: Commit Messages
guidelines.description: Write meaningful commit messages that accurately describe the changes made. Use the imperative mood and keep the messages concise but informative.

guidelines.title: Coding Standards
guidelines.description: Follow the project's coding standards and guidelines to ensure consistency in the codebase. This includes naming conventions, indentation, and other style considerations.

guidelines.title: Testing
guidelines.description: Include tests for new features and bug fixes to ensure the code works as expected. Moreover, run existing tests to make sure your changes do not break other functionality.

guidelines.title: Documentation
guidelines.description: Update the documentation to reflect changes made in the codebase. This includes updating README files, inline documentation, and any other related materials.

guidelines.title: Reviewing Code
guidelines.description: Participate in code reviews by providing constructive feedback on pull requests. Focus on the quality of code, adherence to guidelines, and potential improvements.

guidelines.title: Branching Model
guidelines.description: Use the project's branching model for contributions. Create branches for features, fixes, and other changes rather than committing directly to the main branch.

guidelines.title: Code of Conduct
guidelines.description: All contributors must follow the project's code of conduct to maintain a welcoming and harassment-free environment.

guidelines.title: Reporting Issues
guidelines.description: Report any issues or bugs through the project's issue tracker, providing as much detail and context as possible.

guidelines.title: Submitting Pull Requests
guidelines.description: Submit pull requests for any code changes, ensuring that changes are well-documented and include appropriate tests.

guidelines.title: Branch Naming
guidelines.description: Use descriptive and consistent naming conventions for branches, reflecting the purpose or feature being developed.

guidelines.title: Commit Messages
guidelines.description: Write clear and descriptive commit messages, explaining the changes and reasons behind them.

guidelines.title: Coding Standards
guidelines.description: Adhere to the project's coding standards and style guidelines to ensure consistency and readability across the codebase.

guidelines.title: Documentation Updates
guidelines.description: Ensure that any relevant documentation is updated in parallel with code changes, providing clear instructions and explanations.

guidelines.title: Testing and Continuous Integration
guidelines.description: Run all tests and ensure passing builds before submitting any pull request, leveraging the project's continuous integration tools.
